our_story.title: A short timeline of our story
our_story.subtitle: TODO: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusm od tempor incidi dunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua ut enim minim veniam, quis nostrud.
our_story.how_we_met_description: We met when we were both solo-traveling in Medellin, Columbia. We happened to go on the same bus tour to El Peñón de Guatapé, a giant monolith surrounded by beautiful lakes. We met on 649 steps to the top of the monolith. The climb was followed by a tour to the nearby local town where we visited a small margarita bar.
our_story.moved_to_new_york_description: After our trip Grace moved to New York to start her residency in pediatric dentistry. Mark came to visit shortly after and later moved to New York to join Grace.
our_story.got_engaged_description: In October we went on a trip to the Dominican Republic where Mark planned a surprise proposal in Altos de Chavón, a beautiful Mediterranean style town. She said yes!
our_story.got_married_description: After over a year of waiting we finally got our fiancé visa and were able to get married in central Washington D.C.

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.description: Here's what to expect during our wedding celebration. Feel free to join any part of the event - we can't wait to celebrate with you!
schedule.welcome_event_description:
If you arrive in Copenhagen early - which we highly recommend - please join us for our welcome event! Everyone is welcome to join us, especially those who've made a long journey to be with us on our special day. Please meet us at Ofelia Plads where we will begin a 1-hour canal tour of Copenhagen's historical sites and iconic canals. After the boat tour, we will enjoy light bites and drinks at the waterfront restaurant __ and end the evening watching the sunset! Please let us know if you can make it and if we should reserve a spot for you.

*Please note that this event is weather permitting as it takes place outside and the weather in Copenhagen can be temperamental.
schedule.ceremony_description: Transportation will be provided to and from the wedding - please meet us at __________ at 12:45 pm for pickup. The bus will leave promptly and it will be a 45-minute drive to Allerslev church in Lejre. After the ceremony, the bus will depart at 3:30 pm to Restaurant Herthadalen where the reception will be held.
schedule.reception_description:
A cocktail hour (and treasure hunt) will begin at 4:30 pm and dinner starts at 6:00 pm. Toasts, speeches, songs, games, quizzes and other micro-events are encouraged during or after the dinner (Please reach out to toast-master ___).

Following dinner, we will have our first dance incorporating some Danish traditions and activities. Late night snacks will be provided before the bus departs back to Copenhagen at 11:00 pm.
schedule.saturday_event_title: DAY AFTER LUNCH & TOUR OF COPENHAGEN
schedule.saturday_event_description:
If you want to keep the festivities going, join us for lunch inside a rooftop greenhouse located in Østerbro. The 3-course lunch will begin with a short tour of the rooftop urban farm. Please enter into the yard and climb up the spiral stairs. For those interested, we will go on a walking tour and explore more of Copenhagen in the late afternoon.

*Please note there will be limited space in the greenhouse and we'll be giving priority to out-of-town guests.
schedule.sunday_event_description: If you are still in Copenhagen on Sunday, we would love to spend an afternoon with you at the Harbour Bath - join us for sunbathing while drinking natural wine + eating fresh seafood!

travel.title: Recommendations For Our Out-Of-Town Guests.
travel.getting_to_copenhagen_description:
Copenhagen has only one international airport to fly into: Københavns Lufthavn CPH. Taking the metro from the airport to your hotel or Airbnb is the easiest mode of transport as it runs 24/7. The metro station is located in direct extension of Terminal 3. Tickets for the Metro can be purchased at the station and they take all credit cards. Use the M2 line to get direct to the city center in just 15 minutes.

*Note that Uber does not work in Denmark.
travel.airbnb_description: Luckily Copenhagen is a manageable city to get around in - wherever you end up staying shouldn't be an issue when traveling to any of our wedding festivities. However, we suggest to stay in the city center in København K. Once you have settled on a place to stay, let us know and we can help with instructions on how to get from the airport to your hotel/Airbnb as well as specific directions to the ceremony and surrounding events.
travel.rental_car_description:
2 Lufthavnsboulevarden, Kastrup, 2770, Denmark +45 32 50 30 90

You can also rent a car to travel at your own pace. Use the DK website domain for lower prices. Pickup location is Københavns Lufthavn.
travel.how_to_get_around_in_copenhagen: HOW TO GET AROUND IN COPENHAGEN
travel.how_to_get_around_in_copenhagen_descript:
The main mode of transportation in Copenhagen is by bike, otherwise the public transport system is very easy to use. You can go by bus, the S-train, underground metro, rent a car or even walk. 

You may find it helpful to download the public transport app, called "rejseplanen". This will provide up-to-date timetables and journey planning tools to help you find your way around. Please note Uber is not accessible in Denmark.
travel.how_to_get_around_in_denmark: HOW TO GET AROUND IN COPENHAGEN
travel.how_to_get_around_in_denmark_description:
If you are planning to travel around Denmark after the wedding, it may be helpful to know that Denmark is made up of three main land areas - Jylland, Fyn & Sjælland (Zealand, where Copenhagen is). These areas can be accessed by bus, train, plane, and car. 

The bus company "flixbus.dk" or "sortbillet.dk" are both relative cheap and useful. 

DSB is the train company that connects Copenhagen to other areas of Denmark by train, and tickets can be bought here: https://www.dsb.dk/en/

Flights to Jylland can be bought through "Norwegian Air" or "SAS".
travel.transport_to_reception_description: We will be providing a coach service to take guests from Copenhagen to the wedding venue to reception and returning to Copenhagen after the evening celebrations. Please let us know if you would like a seat on the bus so that we can book the appropriate size coach.

registry.title: registry
registry.description:
You're traveling from near and far, and the biggest gift you can give us is just by you being there to celebrate with us. 

However if you would like to bless us with a gift, please keep in mind that due to travel in our current season of life we may not have much room for storage. Therefore a perfect gift would be "vouchers" for a special adventure, experience, or a savings fund that we can share together.

 Here are some inspiration for wedding gifts
registry.gift_1_description: We would love to spend our honeymoon at a beautiful resort!
registry.gift_2_description: We love to eat out and try new restaurants and go to events!
registry.gift_3_description: We love doing active things together when on vacation like water sports, horseback rides, snowmobiles tours etc.
registry.gift_4_description: We've always wanted to do a road trip in the US!
registry.gift_5_description: We enjoy cooking together, but we would love to learn some new recipes!
registry.gift_6_description: Baking together is always fun, especially danish pastries!
registry.gift_7_description: We're saving up to buy our first home together!
registry.gift_8_description: We have fun trying out new recipes and a food subscriptions make this so easy!

faq.title: FAQ
faq.description: If you have any other questions than what we have listed here, please reach out to Mark at hello@marklyck.com.
faq.when_should_i_arrive_question: WHEN SHOULD I ARRIVE IN COPENHAGEN?
faq.when_should_i_arrive_answer: Preferably by Thursday- We will have a welcome event on Thursday night in order to welcome our out-of-town guests. Let us know when you will be arriving and we will do our best to organize something on the days you are in Copenhagen.
faq.where_should_i_stay_answer: Luckily Copenhagen is a manageable city to get around in - wherever you end up staying shouldn't be an issue when traveling to any of our wedding festivities. However, we suggest to stay in the city center, near København K. Once you have settled on a place to stay, let us know and we can help with instructions on how to get from the airport to your hotel/Airbnb as well as specific directions to the ceremony and surrounding events.
faq.what_is_the_dress_code_answer: Your most dashing attire, and perhaps something warm on top! Please be prepared for Copenhagen weather in June which can vary from rain to sunshine and range between 50-70s °F.
faq.covid_restrictions_question: ARE THERE ANY COVID RESTRICTIONS I SHOULD BE AWARE OF?
faq.covid_restrictions_answer:
There are no Covid-19 related restrictions in Denmark and no vaccines or tests are required to enter the Country.

See https://coronasmitte.dk for any Covid related information.
faq.can_i_bring_a_guest_answer: When you fill out your RSVP, just enter your full name and it will let you know who in your family is invited and if we have a guest listed for you. We wanted to keep the wedding more intimate and wanted to be surrounded by our closest friends and family, so if you did not get a plus one, we hope you can understand where we are coming from.

rsvp_form.rsvp_latest_by: Please RSVP latest by May 1st, 2023, using the form below.
